User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:8.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0.1
Build ID: 20111120135848

Steps to reproduce:

After the latest Mac OS X 10.6 (Snow Leopard) update waking up my Macbook Pro from sleep and trying to start a new tab on Firefox does not work. The tabs are not displayed until after 15-25 seconds and they all get displayed at once. Also, address bar text auto-complete does not work until after 15-25 seconds. 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZgZFKlv9ceg


Actual results:

After the latest Mac OS X 10.6 (Snow Leopard) update waking up my Macbook Pro from sleep and trying to start a new tab on Firefox does not work. The tabs are not displayed until after 15-25 seconds and they all get displayed at once. Also, address bar text auto-complete does not work until after 15-25 seconds. 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZgZFKlv9ceg


Expected results:


New Tabs should be created instantly like normal. Also, auto-complete in address bar should work right away. For now, every time I ope my laptop (wake it up from sleep) if there are multiple tabs I cannot access any of them by clicking on the tab and if I wish to create a new tab the tab doesn't show up. The problem resolves after 15-25 seconds but by then the user experience is completely damaged.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZgZFKlv9ceg
